text: Karenga District is a district in Northern Uganda, in the Karamoja sub-region. The district headquarter is located in Karenga town. It was carved out of Kaabong District and its operations started on July 1st 2019. The district has one constituency: Dodoth West. It borders South Sudan and Kaabong District. The population is 84,100, divided over 7 sub-counties and 3 town councils. Karenga District is located in the vicinity of Kidepo Valley National Park. ==References== Category:Districts of Uganda
title: Karenga District
